ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned so much about art history of different regions (focused on Western art), history, philosophy, photography, and architecture; class discussions were always engaging and challenging. My peers brought so many unique perspectives and professor Suther provided important context and framework for our discussions.
A overview of aesthetic tradtions through the western cannon and how emotion is depicted in art.
Different theories and artistic approaches to pathos and emotion expressed throughout western art history.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course was based on a carefully curated selection of readings that allowed us to have deep and meaningful conversations while providing our own perspectives from different fields. The diversity of the classroom was a huge strength of the course. professor Suthor was available during office hours to help us refine our presentations and to provide helpful feedback. I do not believe there was any weakness for this course.

Great discussion and focused assigned readings. Graduate students gave a more advanced and helpful understanding to the material. It would have been nice to have a bit more guidance on expectations for the short and final papers, however. Feedback from Prof Suthor was excellent! The presentations were also very helpful. This was a fantastic course!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely! it was one of my favorite courses at Yale, and taught me perspectives that I will continue to explore for the rest of my academic and intellectual careers.

Absolutely! Any course with Professor Suthor is worth taking. She is kind and very intelligent, and very invested in her students! The readings are carefully chosen and fundamental to the course material.
